title: Comparability graph
summary: In graph theory, a comparability graph is an undirected graph that connects pairs of elements that are comparable to each other in a partial order. Comparability graphs have also been called transitively orientable graphs, partially orderable graphs, containment graphs,[1] and divisor graphs.[2] An incomparability graph is an undirected graph that connects pairs of elements that are not comparable to each other in a partial order.
